The identification of the type of market structure within which a firm is operating
is based on the characteristics we outlined earlier. Our earlier table is repeated here
in Figure 23. Because the analyst is attempting to determine the degree of pricing
power firms in the industry have, the focus is on number of firms in the industry,
the importance of barriers to entry, the nature of substitute products, and the nature
of industry competition. Significant interdependence among firm pricing and
output decisions is always a characteristic of an oligopoly market, although some
interdependence is present under monopolistic competition, even with many more firms
than for an oligopoly structure.
